data.title: THE HORROR ENTERTAINMENT MAGAZINE
data.meta_description: All the latest news from Scream: The UK’s No1 Horror Entertainment Magazine!
data.text:
It’s been quite some time since we’ve had any movement from The Ring’s American reboot series, but that could be about to change. According to a reliable source, a fourth film in the series is in the works. Said to focus on Samara Morgan’s vengeful spirit now inhabiting a viral video, the project will come …Read More

She’s a fuckin’ movie star… Ti West’s MaXXXine was easily one of the most anticipated horror movies of the year, so it’s little surprise that fans turned out to support it. Following the events of 2022’s X, MaXXXine picks up in 1985, following Mia Goth’s titular character as she navigates the path to movie stardom. …Read More

“I did what’s best for my family…” Blumhouse are really enjoying this trend of modern technology gone awry, aren’t they? First, they delighted us with M3GAN, then announced her spin-off movie SOULM8TE… Now, they’ve given us new cause to be Afraid. In a newly-released trailer for a project that’s been kept largely hidden, we see …Read More

We do enjoy reporting on the streaming debut of movies we’ve covered over the year, it feels rather satisfying. Also, not everyone is able to attend the theatre, and we’re happy to play a small part in brightening up their week. To that end we’re happy to announce that two movies we’ve reported on extensively …Read More

Just as we’re on the heels of Final Destination: Bloodlines, the news comes to us that franchise creator Jeffrey Reddick has a new genre project in the works. As well as executive producing the upcoming sixth entry, Reddick is set to bring us a modern take on a classic urban legend, with Bloody Mary: Origins. …Read More

HBO and Max are coming at us thick and fast with info on the It prequel series Welcome to Derry. Just last week we reported that the show had been upgraded from a streaming original, and will air concurrently on HBO and Max. At the same time, we learned that the cast had grown considerably, …Read More

“I can’t stop… I have to do this last one.” We’re slightly less than one month away from the release of M. Night Shyamalan’s Trap. So, to tide us over until August 2nd, Warner Bros. have gifted us with a final trailer. Whilst many have called this unnecessary, others have lauded the clip for its …Read More

It’s been a tough few months at the box-office for horror, but we’re back to our best thanks to Paramount’s A Quiet Place: Day One. The highly-anticipated prequel was initially set to debut to $40-50 million by industry insiders, but would ultimately see a domestic debut of $52.2 million. This total marks the best opening …Read More

Unfortunately, it is our sad duty to report that Shelley Duvall, best known for her role in 1980’s The Shining, has died. Duvall’s career began by chance in 1970, when she met filmmaker Robert Altman at a party in her native Texas. Altman was prepping his film Brewster McCloud at the time, and immediately cast …Read More

We feared for horror icon Sarah Michelle Gellar when her Paramount+ series Wolf Pack was cancelled. A second season was on the cards, but the streaming service instead decided to nix the show due to strike-related delays. Gellar’s return to horror heralded much fanfare, given the genre made the actress a cultural icon with Buffy …Read More

It’s been a while since we heard any news on the proposed Halloween television series in the works at Miramax and Trancas International. Last we heard, the project was “moving along nicely,” and assembling a creative team, following a heated bidding war for the rights. With Miramax the eventual victors against A24, the series was …Read More

Following the confirmation that Bill Skarsgard will reprise his role as Pennywise, interest in the series Welcome to Derry has increased considerably. In fact, anticipation for the prequel show has ramped up to such a degree, that Welcome to Derry is no longer a streaming only event. It has been confirmed that the series is …Read More

Time to start practicing folks, because we’ll soon be screaming again, if new reports are to be believed. According to an official line given to Production Weekly, Scream 7 has been confirmed to begin shooting in September of 2024. This tracks with what star Neve Campbell has said at numerous convention appearances, backed up by …Read More

Recently, we reported that Spyglass Media was prepping their next big horror outing. No, not Scream 7, but the horror rom-com Heart Eyes. Penned by Happy Death Day’s Christopher Landon, the project stars Scream’s Mason Gooding. The plot will centre on a serial killer targeting couples on Valentine’s Day. Hijinks ensue as he mistakes a …Read More

“He’s coming…” After debuting exclusively in theatres on June 18th, the first trailer for Robert Eggers Nosferatu remake dropped online this past week. Expertly keeping the mystery alive, the short clip is careful not to show us anything of Bill Skarsgard’s sinister Count Orlok. Just as the actor is about to turn around and reveal …Read More

Two horror icons are among those receiving stars on the Hollywood Walk of Fame, as they announce their picks for The Class of 2025. First up, we have Freddy Krueger himself finally getting the accolade, as Robert Englund will have his 50-year career honoured. Despite being one of horror’s most recognizable faces for over four …Read More

Are you getting ready for a date night and choosing a movie to watch together? Don’t rush to choose a drama or comedy – a horror movie can be a better option. This article will explain how horror movies can elevate your dating experience. At the end of the article, you will find tips on …Read More

This list explores the top 15 horror games perfect for students. Get ready for chilling adventures, suspenseful stories, and monsters that will haunt your dreams! Students need to strike the proper balance between schoolwork and leisure time. One great way for them to relax is by immersing themselves in horror video games. Not only are …Read More

Blumhouse are set to create their first expanded Universe, and their chosen world is that of 2023’s runaway hit, M3GAN. Described as being set in the same world, SOULM8TE will similarly focus on an android gone awry, and will see release in 2026. The spin-off is described as a “dark romance” with comedy elements, and …Read More

It’s been quite a while since we’ve had an update on the unexpected, but very welcome, sequel They Follow. The movie is a follow-up to David Robert Mitchell’s 2014 film It Follows, and details a young woman’s plight as she is stalked by a shape-shifting entity passed on through a sexual encounter. NEON, the hot …Read More

A few weeks ago, Blumhouse and Universal announced that acclaimed genre filmmaker Mike Flanagan would take on The Exorcist franchise. With the director championing his vision as “a radical new take” on the mythology, audiences were cautiously curious. Now, we have our first major update since then, with Universal confirming that the film will release …Read More

Things are not looking good for A24’s Friday the 13th television adaption Crystal Lake… Although Peacock are sticking by their claims to “press ahead” with the show, more details have emerged on how and why showrunner Bryan Fuller left the project. Furthermore, we’ve gotten a deeper look into what we could’ve seen, had Crystal Lake …Read More

“Stop smiling at me!” We’re hurtling towards the release of Parker Finn’s greatly-anticipated sequel, Smile 2. With four months to go until the October 18th release date, Paramount Pictures decided to gift us with a teaser trailer. Exhibiting a much grander sense of scale, the trailer introduces us to popstar Skye Riley. As she sings …Read More

Jordan Peele is coming back! Unfortunately, he won’t be unleashing his next work to screens for over 2 years. Yes, you read that right, 2 whole years. This past week it was announced that Peele’s fourth film as a director will release on October 23rd 2026. A project veiled in secrecy; Peele revealed the new …Read More

Filming is officially complete on Damien Leone’s highly anticipated Terrifier 3. The completion of pick-up shots was announced this past week, along with some huge casting news. Jason Patric, star of the 1987 cult classic The Lost Boys, has been announced as a key cast member in Terrifier 3. It is currently not known what …Read More

A few weeks ago, it was reported that the long-awaited film adaption of the hit horror video game Until Dawn was in the works. Whilst things are still being kept quiet, we have a sizeable update as we learn some of the cast names attached to the project. An ensemble of rising stars has been …Read More

He took the world by surprise with Evil Dead Rise, now filmmaker Lee Cronin has something else up his sleeve… We’re just not allowed to know what it is yet.
